title: Warning signs of a Stroke
tertiaryText: You can easily spot the signs of a stroke if you remember the acronym F.A.S.T. The F means face drooping. The A stands for arm weakness. The S stands for speech difficulty. The T stands for Time to call your local emergency number if you see the above warning signs.You can learn more at www.heart.org/warningsigns. This information is not a substitute for medical advice or treatment, and the AHA recommends consultation with your doctor or healthcare professional.
speakText: If you think you are having a stroke, call your local emergency number immediately. You can easily spot the signs of a stroke if you remember the acronym <say-as interpret-as='spell-out'>FAST</say-as> The F means face drooping. The A stands for arm weakness. The S stands for speech difficulty. The T stands for Time to call your local emergency number if you see the above warning signs. You can learn more at www.heart.org/warningsigns. This information is not a substitute for medical advice or treatment, and the <say-as interpret-as='spell-out'>AHA</say-as> recommends consultation with your doctor or healthcare professional. What else can I help you with?
